newsitem.title: USA: Dun & Bradstreet, LYCOS unveil web directory.
newsitem.headline: Dun & Bradstreet, LYCOS unveil web directory.

text.p: Dun & Bradstreet Corp and Lycos Inc on Tuedsay unveiled an internet directory focused on online businesses, the firms said.
Terms of the agreement between Dun and Lycos were not disclosed.
The free service, named CompaniesOnline, is available on the Internet's World Wide Web and features information on 60,000 public and private U.S. companies, all with sites on the World Wide Web.
Dun will provide the company-specific information, while Lycos will supply the search engine technology to navigate the information in the directory, they said.
To support the directory's debut, Dun said it will send out a direct mail announcement to 50,000 companies in January promoting CompaniesOnline and outlining how the service works.
Lycos is majority owned by CMG Information Services Inc.
